head.title: U.S. and Italy Are Ahead in Bridge Tourney

hedline.hl1: U.S. and Italy Are Ahead in Bridge Tourney

abstract.p: US and Italy take lead in finals of World Bridge Championships in Maastricht, Netherlands (S)

block.p: The finals of the World Bridge Championship began here this afternoon, and the United States took the lead in one match and Italy took the lead in the other.

In the women's play, the United States led Canada by 10 imps after 16 deals. The Americans, all from Texas, are Joan Jackson, Robin Klar, Peggy Sutherlin, Petra Hamman, Shawn Quinn and Mildred Breed. Their opponents are Francine Cimon, Diana Gordon, Rhoda Habert, Beverly Kraft, Martine Lacroix and Catherine Thorpe.
The finals of the World Bridge Championship began here this afternoon, and the United States took the lead in one match and Italy took the lead in the other.

In the women's play, the United States led Canada by 10 imps after 16 deals. The Americans, all from Texas, are Joan Jackson, Robin Klar, Peggy Sutherlin, Petra Hamman, Shawn Quinn and Mildred Breed. Their opponents are Francine Cimon, Diana Gordon, Rhoda Habert, Beverly Kraft, Martine Lacroix and Catherine Thorpe.
In semifinal play on Wednesday, the Americans beat Norway by 123 and the Canadians beat Germany by 44 (although the result first posted was 49).

In the Open Teams, Italy started strongly against Poland, leading by 27 after 16 deals. The gods of the game smiled on the Italian players, Norberto Bocchi, Giorgio Duboin, Lorenzo Lauria, Alfredo Versace, Dano De Falco and Guido Ferraro. They played in a small slam while their opponents reached a grand slam. This failed only because two suits broke badly and an Italian hit on the only effective opening lead.
The Polish players are Cezary Balicki, Krzysztof Jassem, Machal Kwiecien, Jacek Pszczola, Adam Zmudzinski and Piotr Tuszynski.
In semifinal play, Italy beat England by 85 and Poland beat the United States by 104.
